item.title: Porn Star Plays New Role As Advocate For Industry
item.description: May 3, 2017 - This week on 'Brave New Workers': After 20 years working as a performer in the adult entertainment industry, Alana Evans is putting her efforts into organizing for the Adult Performers Actors Guild.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - This week on 'Brave New Workers': After 20 years working as a performer in the adult entertainment industry, Alana Evans is putting her efforts into organizing for the Adult Performers Actors Guild. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/30/526038437/porn-star-plays-new-role-as-advocate-for-industry

item.title: Man Who Claimed To Be 146 Years Old Dies In Indonesia
item.description: May 3, 2017 - An Indonesian who claimed to have been born in 1870 died this week. If true, at 146, he would have been the oldest person ever by far. Indonesia didn't record births until 1900, however.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - An Indonesian who claimed to have been born in 1870 died this week. If true, at 146, he would have been the oldest person ever by far. Indonesia didn't record births until 1900, however. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/03/526690256/man-who-claimed-to-be-146-years-old-dies-in-indonesia

item.title: As House GOP Struggles With A Health Care Bill, Republican Options Narrow
item.description: May 3, 2017 - Despite pressure from the White House and GOP leaders, Republicans have not yet secured enough votes to get health care replacement through the House, let alone the Senate. So, what are their choices?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 3, 2017 - Despite pressure from the White House and GOP leaders, Republicans have not yet secured enough votes to get health care replacement through the House, let alone the Senate. So, what are their choices? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/03/526622567/as-house-gop-struggles-with-a-health-care-bill-republican-options-narrow

item.title: More Salt In School Lunch, Less Nutrition Info On Menus: Trump Rolls Back Food Rules
item.description: May 2, 2017 - The Trump administration says it wants to remove burdensome regulation. On Monday it served up a taste of what that looks like when it comes to aspects of Obama-era food policy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - The Trump administration says it wants to remove burdensome regulation. On Monday it served up a taste of what that looks like when it comes to aspects of Obama-era food policy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/02/526448646/trump-administration-rolls-back-obama-era-rules-on-calorie-counts-school-lunch

item.title: A Child's Suffering Drives A Mother To Seek Untested Treatments
item.description: May 2, 2017 - When medication wasn't relieving her 3-year-old son's juvenile arthritis, Susannah Meadows started investigating non-medical treatments like diet and supplements.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - When medication wasn't relieving her 3-year-old son's juvenile arthritis, Susannah Meadows started investigating non-medical treatments like diet and supplements. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526436381/a-childs-suffering-drives-a-mother-to-seek-untested-treatments

item.title: Death Rate Among Black Americans Declines, Especially For Elderly People
item.description: May 2, 2017 - The CDC says the death rate for black Americans fell 25 percent over 17 years and was especially dramatic for those 65 and older. But young black people are still dying earlier than white Americans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - The CDC says the death rate for black Americans fell 25 percent over 17 years and was especially dramatic for those 65 and older. But young black people are still dying earlier than white Americans. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526433607/death-rate-among-black-americans-declines-especially-for-elderly-people

item.title: Doctors Prescribe More Generics When Drug Reps Are Kept At Bay
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Doctors were more likely to choose generic drugs over pricier brand names when teaching hospitals limited access by pharmaceutical sales representatives, a study finds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Doctors were more likely to choose generic drugs over pricier brand names when teaching hospitals limited access by pharmaceutical sales representatives, a study finds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526558565/doctors-prescribe-more-generics-when-drug-reps-are-kept-at-bay

item.title: The Fine Print In The 'State Of Black America' Report
item.description: May 2, 2017 - This year's "State of Black America" report took the unusual step of warning that the organization now has a new priority: protecting areas of progress from retrenchment during the next few years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - This year's "State of Black America" report took the unusual step of warning that the organization now has a new priority: protecting areas of progress from retrenchment during the next few years. http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2017/05/02/499244087/the-fine-print-in-the-state-of-black-america-report

item.title: Veterans At Risk Of Suicide Negotiate A Thorny Relationship With Guns
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Researchers say putting guns out of reach reduces the chances that suicidal veterans could take their own lives, but changing the law is a controversial idea.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Researchers say putting guns out of reach reduces the chances that suicidal veterans could take their own lives, but changing the law is a controversial idea. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/02/526421055/veterans-at-risk-of-suicide-negotiate-a-thorny-relationship-with-guns

item.title: A New Generation Overthrows Gender
item.description: May 2, 2017 - Parents, schools and elected officials are working to catch up and adapt to the needs of children and teens who don't fit into familiar gender categories.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 2, 2017 - Parents, schools and elected officials are working to catch up and adapt to the needs of children and teens who don't fit into familiar gender categories. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/02/526067768/a-new-generation-overthrows-gender

item.title: President Trump Promotes Revised Version Of GOP Health Care Bill
item.description: May 1, 2017 - President Trump is promising great things from the revised version of the Republican health care bill. He said it would lower premiums, increase competition and protect people with pre-existing conditions "beautifully."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - President Trump is promising great things from the revised version of the Republican health care bill. He said it would lower premiums, increase competition and protect people with pre-existing conditions "beautifully." http://www.npr.org/2017/05/01/526436036/president-trump-promotes-revised-version-of-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: Why Mexican Chefs, Farmers And Activists Are Reviving The Ancient Grain Amaranth
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The nutritious indigenous plant is part of a movement to revive native crops and cuisines — and a means of restoring the health and economy of Oaxaca, one of Mexico's poorest states.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The nutritious indigenous plant is part of a movement to revive native crops and cuisines — and a means of restoring the health and economy of Oaxaca, one of Mexico's poorest states. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/01/526033083/why-mexican-chefs-farmers-and-activists-are-reviving-the-ancient-grain-amaranth

item.title: Fasting Studies Clash With Our Desire To Eat What We Want, When We Want It
item.description: May 1, 2017 - Fasting every other day is no better for losing weight or keeping it off than restricting calories every day, a study suggests. And it's yet another example of how hard it is to study fasting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - Fasting every other day is no better for losing weight or keeping it off than restricting calories every day, a study suggests. And it's yet another example of how hard it is to study fasting. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526069419/fasting-studies-clash-with-our-desire-to-eat-what-we-want-when-we-want-it

item.title: NIH Study Aims To Unravel The Illness Known As 'Chronic Fatigue Syndrome'
item.description: May 1, 2017 - Researchers do not know what causes people with the condition now known as ME/CFS to suffer debilitating exhaustion and other symptoms that make many everyday activities all but impossible.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - Researchers do not know what causes people with the condition now known as ME/CFS to suffer debilitating exhaustion and other symptoms that make many everyday activities all but impossible. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/01/526372209/nih-study-aims-to-unravel-the-illness-known-as-chronic-fatigue-syndrome

item.title: Celebrity Chef Tom Colicchio: 'We Can End Hunger In This Country'
item.description: May 1, 2017 - The Top Chef judge, restaurateur and hunger advocate says many of our nation's problems are related to food. One of the biggest ways to address this is to make meals more nutritious and accessible.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 1, 2017 - The Top Chef judge, restaurateur and hunger advocate says many of our nation's problems are related to food. One of the biggest ways to address this is to make meals more nutritious and accessible. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/01/526048187/celebrity-chef-tom-colicchio-we-can-end-hunger-in-this-country
